oai_dc:dc.dc:title: List of sick, lame, and fatigued at Bogue Chitto
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: On this two-sided "List of Men left in my charge Sick. Lame & wound out with fatigue," Dr. William Lawrence reports sixty-four unfit men. List includes not only their names, but it identifies their militia companies. Several deaths are noted at bottom of page 2.

William Pitt Lawrence was Surgeon, 3rd Regiment, Tennessee Militia, during the War of 1812. The regiment was probably returning to Tennessee after the Battle of New Orleans (January 8, 1815). Their camp was eleven miles from Allen's Ferry on Bogue Chitto.
